diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis and hydrops of the gallbladder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with right upper quadrant abdominal pain and had a history of choledocholithiasis treated with ERCP. Imaging revealed stones and sludge in the gallbladder without wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid, suggesting acute cholecystitis. Additionally, the patient had a postoperative delirium, indicating a complication related to surgery.
